body: collect blood from subject \(human or mouse)
prepare EDTA plasma

store plasma at -80 °C before use
  


B. Preparation of precipitation agent containing internal standards
dissolve 50 g/L ZnSO<sub>4</sub> in water
mix ZnSO<sub>4</sub> solution 1:1 with methanol \(v/v) to get the precipitation agent

dilute internal standards in precipitation agent: <sup>13</sup>C<sub>2</sub>-Testosterone 1.5 ng/mL \(final concentration); d4-Cortisol 7.5 ng/mL \(final concentration); d9-Progesterone 1.5 ng/mL \(final concentration); d8-Corticosterone 15 ng/mL \(final concentration)

place at -20 °C before use
  


C. Sample preparation
mix 50 µL plasma with 100 µL precipitation agent
vortex mix for 60 s
incubate at 4 °C for 30 min with continuous shaking
centrifuge at 14000 rpm at 4 °C for 10 min

transfer supernatant to deep well plate for measurement
  


D. Chromatographic separation of samples

prepare solvents for chromatography; methanol:water \(5:95) for solid phase extraction; acetonitrile:water:formic acid \(10:90:0.1) as solvent A for gradient run; acetonitrile:formic acid \(100:0.1) as solvent B for gradient run
equilibrate chromatographic system with solvents \(gradient flow rate is 0.5 mL/min; online-SPE flow rate is 3 mL/min
inject 80 µL of supernatant via autosampler

apply gradient and valve switching information \(sample is enriched on online-SPE column and eluted in backflush onto the analytical column) from table 1
  


E. MS/MS analysis
measure samples in positive mode using an ESI source
set ion source parameters to CUR = 20; CAD = 6; IS = 4500; TEM = 600; GS1 = 40; GS2 = 55
use the multiple reaction monitoring \(MRM) mass transitions given in table 1

for calibration run standards in the following concentrations: 0.1, 0.19, 0.39, 0.78, 1.56, 3.13, 6.25, 12.5, 25 ng/mL for androstenedione, testosterone, progesterone, and 17OH-progesterone; 0.98, 1.95, 3.91, 7.81, 15.63, 31.25, 62.5, 125, 250 ng/mL for cortisone, cortisol, and corticosterone
also run appropriate blanks \(steroid stripped plasma) and quality control samples
evaluate results using Analyst 1.4.2 software \(Applied Biosystems)
